intro: Anaphalioides papuana, commonly known as the Papuan featherflower, is a flowering plant native to Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by wind, a common adaptation in its native habitat. It typically grows in open, sunny areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
